analytic.title: Le Vaticinans Puer I: la tradition syriaque

monogr.title: Les naissances merveilleuses en Orient: Jacques Vermeylen (1942–2014) in memoriam

biblStruct.note: The recently discovered Kathisma-church in the neighbourhoud of Jerusalem has been related to the whereabouts of the Holy Virgin according to the Gospel of Pseudo-Matthews. In order to appreciate its significance, we propose that the later tradition of the legend of the Cave of Treasures, as represented by the Opus Imperfectum and the Zuqnîn Chronicle, should also be included in the dossier to fully comprehend its typological theology.

body.bibl: Reeth, Jan M. F. van. “Le Vaticinans Puer I: La Tradition Syriaque.” In Les Naissances Merveilleuses En Orient: Jacques Vermeylen (1942–2014) in Memoriam, edited by Christian Cannuyer and Catherine Vialle, 225–50. Acta Orientalia Belgica 28. Bruxelles: Société royale belge d’études orientales, 2015.

Jan M. F. van Reeth, Le Vaticinans Puer I: La Tradition Syriaque,” in Les Naissances Merveilleuses En Orient: Jacques Vermeylen (1942–2014) in Memoriam, ed. Christian Cannuyer and Catherine Vialle, Acta Orientalia Belgica 28 (Bruxelles: Société royale belge d’études orientales, 2015), 225–50.
